issue.title: [CF 887] DefensiveBuffs - missing some items?
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create an icon to monitor buff/debuff
2. Use the prefab list "DefensiveBuffs" in the spells to check
3. Mouse over the green item … does not list some items I think should be included:
   - Last Stand (12975)
   - Rallying Cry (97462)
   - Ironbark (102342)
   - Hand of Purity (114039) admittedly this is a small cd

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
I am trying to use the "DefensiveBuffs" prefab list to detect any external CD put on me (as a tank).  In a perfect world, the spells in the prefab list would be sorted, perhaps alphabetically, for better readability.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v7.0.0r193

Do you have an error log of what happened?
no

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav | Imported from CurseForge issue #887 | Raw

comments.body:
Thanks. Added in bd2cddc. Things should be sorted in the tooltips now, too.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Cybeloras,

Thanks … just tested the change. Last Stand worked for me, and the ordering is great.

However, Rallying Cry did not trigger - which was weird. I double-checked the lua and wow head, and 97462 seem to be the correct spell ID. I even created a single buff monitor to monitor just Rallying Cry (97462) and that also did not trigger. (This showed up as blue in the buff list which is correct according to wow head.)

So I did a bit of digging and found another Rallying Cry - 97463. So I set up a bar to track 3 items: DefensiveBuffs, ID's 97462 and ID 97463. As I warrior, when I popped Rallying Cry, only the latter (97463) triggered to my surprise. So that seems to mean that wow head is wrong?

I don't know what this means for your add-on … but clearly 97462 does not seem to be the Warrior Rallying Cry. 97463 seems to be the correct spell id. Which I think means a change in the DefensiveBuffs lua and maybe elsewhere is you specifically code the spell ids?

Or maybe I'm doing something wrong?

Hope this makes sense. Following is the simple tracker I made to test:

> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

And for the record, tracking "Rallying Cry" (left click instead of right click), works, which makes sense if it is tracking all the possible spell id's for Rallying Cry.


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

Wowhead is correct. http://www.wowhead.com/spell=97462 has no buff associated. http://www.wowhead.com/spell=97463 does.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Ah… I see the difference now. 97462/Blue is my ability which I can track the cool down, while 97463/Purple is the buff I get from using the ability. Thanks for the clarification.

I just updates and tested Last Stand / Rallying Cry - both proc as expected when using DefensiveBuffs. And as mentioned, the alphabetical sorting of the buff list is easy money!

Thanks for the quick fix and responses - it is appreciated!


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav
